## Privacy Policy
This policy is effective as of 10th December 2024
#### 1. Introduction
At Splan, we value your privacy and are committed to safeguarding your Personal Data. This policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal information when you use our services, and the rights you have regarding your data. By using our Websites and Services, you consent to the collection and processing of your Personal Data as described in this Privacy Policy.
#### 2. Personal Information We Collect
##### 2.1. Information you provide to us
When you interact with our Services, you may provide us with various types of Personal Data, including but not limited to your name, email address, phone number, and account details. We may collect information directly from you when you register, subscribe, or make inquiries through our contact forms.
##### 2.2. Automatic data collection
We use automated data collection technologies (such as cookies and tracking pixels) to gather information about your use of our Services, including your IP address, browser type, device information, and browsing behavior. This information helps us improve our services and provide a better user experience.
##### 2.3. User comments and content
Any content, comments, or feedback you provide through our Websites or Services may be collected and used to improve our services. Please be mindful of the information you choose to share publicly.
##### 2.4. Information from other sources
In some cases, we may also obtain Personal Data from third-party sources to supplement our records. This could include data from our business partners or third-party integrations.
#### 3. Types of Information
We collect a range of Personal Data that may include:
* Identifying information (e.g., name, contact information)
* Account-related data (e.g., login credentials, user preferences)
* Activity data (e.g., user interactions with our services)
* Payment and transaction information (e.g., billing details)
* Feedback and communication details (e.g., customer service inquiries)
#### 4. How We Use Personal Information
We use your Personal Data for various purposes, including:
* To provide, maintain, and improve our services
* To communicate with you regarding updates, promotions, or account matters
* To personalize your experience based on your preferences
* For legal obligations, including compliance with data protection laws
* To ensure security, fraud prevention, and compliance with our terms
##### 4.1. In Mails and Contact Forms
Your email address and other provided information may be used to respond to inquiries and send you updates about our services.
#### 5. Price and Taxes
We may collect billing information and payment data when you make purchases through our services. These transactions are processed securely, and we comply with relevant tax laws.
#### 6. Children's Privacy
We do not knowingly collect personal information from individuals under the age of 18. If you believe that we have inadvertently collected such information, please contact us immediately to have it removed.
#### 7. Data Shared with Third Parties
We may share your Personal Data with third parties for the following reasons:
* **Service providers:** To help us deliver our services and manage operations
* **Legal obligations:** In cases of legal requests, compliance, or to protect our legal interests
* **Business transfers:** In the event of a merger or acquisition
We ensure that third-party partners handle your data with the same level of security and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.
#### 8. Security Measures
We implement security measures to protect your Personal Data from unauthorized access, disclosure, or misuse. This includes encryption for data both in transit and at rest, regular security audits, and maintaining a secure environment. However, please note that no system is completely secure, and you are also responsible for safeguarding your own data, such as logging out of shared devices and using secure passwords.
#### 9. Changes in the Privacy Policy
We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on our Websites, and we will notify you of material updates via email or notifications through the service. It’s your responsibility to review the Privacy Policy periodically to stay informed about our data practices.
#### 10. Your Rights Regarding Your Information and Accessing and Correcting Your Information
You have certain rights under applicable data protection laws, including the right to:
* Access and update your Personal Data
* Restrict how your data is used
* Request data portability
* Withdraw consent or request erasure of your data
* File a complaint with a supervisory authority
If you wish to exercise any of these rights, please contact us using the information below.
#### 11. Do Not Track Signals
We do not currently honor "Do Not Track" signals from web browsers. We continue to collect information through automated means unless you disable cookies or tracking technologies via your browser settings.
#### 12. Data Security
We take reasonable steps to protect your Personal Data from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. This includes employing encryption techniques for sensitive information and using secure servers. Please note that the transmission of data over the internet is never fully secure, and we cannot guarantee the security of your data transmitted to our services. Any transmission is at your own risk.
#### 13. Consent to Processing of Personal Data in the United States
Your Personal Data may be processed outside your home country, including in the United States. If you are a resident of the European Economic Area (EEA), we adhere to relevant data protection regulations, including the use of Standard Contractual Clauses for data transfers.
#### 14. Data Retention Periods
We retain your Personal Data for as long as necessary to provide our services, comply with legal requirements, and protect our legal interests. If you close your account, we may retain certain data as required by law or for backup purposes.

## Questions and Answers
Everything You Need to Know About Splan Visitor Management Pricing and Features
##### 1. What features are included in the Splan Visitor Management packages?
Splan Visitor Management offers a range of features including visitor pre-registration, customizable check-in flows, self-service kiosks, real-time notifications, advanced data security, and compliance.

Yes! Splan provides a personalized demo and a Proof of Concept (POC) so you can experience the platform’s capabilities firsthand. This allows you to assess how it fits your organization’s needs.

Selecting the best plan depends on your organization's needs. If you're looking for basic visitor tracking, the Standard package may be ideal.

Splan Visitor Management includes free initial setup, and our support team is available to assist with configuration, ensuring a smooth implementation process.

Splan Visitor Management adheres to the highest security standards, including encryption for both data in transit and at rest (TLS and AES-256). We also implement strict data isolation as well.

Yes, you can cancel or upgrade your plan at any time. If your needs evolve, you can switch to a higher tier to access additional features, or downgrade to a plan that better suits your needs.

	 	Fortifying Data Centers:
	The Crucial Role of Visitor Management
	
	 	
	
	
	By Marketing Team
	
	
	November 24, 2020
	
	
	Visitor management is crucial for all industries and buildings, but it holds particular significance for Data Centers due to the unique challenges they face in safeguarding sensitive information and maintaining operational efficiency.
	The integration of Visitor Management with Access Control Systems enhances Data Center security by allowing only authorized visitors. It streamlines verification, saves time, and boosts operational efficiency. Strict restrictions on data rack access protect sensitive information, and added physical security mitigates risks like theft and sabotage. The integration ensures compliance, strengthens data security, intellectual property protection, and aligns with the organization's commitment to safeguarding critical resources within the Data Center environment.
	
	
	
	
	Here are some reasons why visitor management is more critical for Data Centers compared to other industries and buildings:
	
	1. Data Security Concerns: Data Centers store vast amounts of sensitive information for various organizations, making them prime targets for cyberattacks and espionage. Unauthorized access to a Data Center can lead to data breaches, compromising the confidentiality and integrity of critical data.
	For instance, in 2019, Equifax, a major credit reporting agency, suffered a data breach that exposed the personal information of nearly 147 million people. The breach was a result of poor visitor management practices and insufficient security measures.
	Source: https://sevenpillarsinstitute.org/case-study-equifax-data-breach/
	2. Intellectual Property Protection: Data Centers often host proprietary and intellectual property data, making them attractive to competitors and malicious actors. Effective visitor management ensures that only authorized individuals have access to these valuable assets.
	For example: In 2018, Tesla filed a lawsuit against a former employee who allegedly stole sensitive data and leaked it to third parties. Accelerated visitor management could have mitigated the risk of such insider threats.
	Source:https://www.cnbc.com/2018/06/20/tesla-sues-former-employee-for-allegedly-stealing-gigabytes-of-data-making-false-claims-to-media.html
	3. 24/7 Accessibility: Data Centers operate round the clock, requiring continuous monitoring of visitors and activities. Proper visitor registration and identification systems help maintain accountability for any incidents that may occur during non-business hours.
	Say, 2020, a fire broke out at a Data Center in France, disrupting internet services and causing significant financial losses. Improved visitor management and mustering could have facilitated a faster response to the emergency.
	Source:https://www.tbsnews.net/world/fire-breaks-out-ovh-building-strasbourg-france-214063

## Splan Deepens EHR Integration with Enhanced HL7 Connector, Simplifying Healthcare Visitor Management
#### Fremont, California. January 26, 2024
Splan, a leading provider of visitor management solutions, today announced a significant upgrade to its integration with Epic software, upgrading its powerful HL7 connector. The connector enables secure and automated data exchange not just with Epic but with any EHR system across the healthcare network. This enhanced connection streamlines workflows and automate the visitor identity access process for healthcare facilities, from pre-registration and check-in to on-site management and check-out. The integration eliminates manual tasks, saving valuable time and resources for staff. Moreover, the solution supports various workflows, including COVID-19 health and safety compliance checks, fostering a safer environment.
Splan offers both lobby workstation software and self-service kiosks for visitors, ensuring a smooth and intuitive check-in process. It empowers healthcare facilities to implement personalized patient visit policies directly within the visitor management system. This integration seamlessly pulls data from any EHR system, ensuring policies like visitor limits per patient, watchlist monitoring, and automated hospice exceptions.
Imagine a scenario where a patient's record indicates they are on hospice care and only immediate family members are allowed for visits. Splan, informed by the EHR data, automatically flags unauthorized visitors, preventing unnecessary disruptions and ensuring patient comfort. Similarly, watchlists for high-risk individuals can be automatically implemented, enhancing security without manual intervention.
"Splan's HL7 connector represents a paradigm shift in healthcare visitor management,"said **Chandra Surabhi, SVP Engineering and Services** at Splan. "By unifying disparate EHR systems, we empower healthcare providers with a future-proof solution, regardless of their chosen platform. This translates to streamlined operations, robust security, and a frictionless visitor experience for everyone."
****About Splan:****
Splan is a leading provider of full-featured Unified Identity & Badging, Visitor Management solutions designed to address customers' safety, security, compliance, and digital transformation needs. Splan's solutions are deployed in a variety of industries in over 60 countries and support more than 20 languages. With a focus on empowering customers to efficiently manage visitors, vendors, tenants, contractors, and deliveries, Splan's capabilities offer risk mitigation while improving the overall visitor, contractor, and employee experience.
For more details on Splan's HL7 connector and its commitment to elevating visitor management in healthcare, please visit [**www.splan.com**](https://www.splan.com/) or [**info@splan.com**](mailto:info@splan.com.)

	October 30, 2023
	
	
	
	
	
	In today's fast-paced world, traditional visitor management systems are becoming obsolete. The advent of mobile credentialing has revolutionized the way organizations handle visitors, offering a seamless and secure alternative. This technology isn't limited to a single sector; it has wide-ranging benefits across various settings, including offices, schools, hospitals, and more. Check out how our Splan’s Mobile Credentialing helps various industries with their visitor management needs.
	1. Offices - Streamlined and Secure Visitor Check-In
	Let's begin with offices. Splan’s Mobile Credentialing allows hosts to send electronic invitations to their guests. These invitations contain digital credentials that can be easily downloaded to the visitor's smartphone. When the visitor arrives, all they need to do is present their mobile credential for entry. This eliminates the need for outdated paper visitor logs or physical badges, and it enhances both security and the visitor experience.
	
	2. Educational Institutions - Enhanced Security
	In educational settings, schools and universities have embraced Splan’s Mobile Credentialing. They can issue temporary mobile credentials to guest speakers, parents, contractors, and other visitors. These digital passes grant them access to the campus, specific buildings, or rooms. This not only ensures that visitors are properly tracked but also maintains a high level of security
	
	3. Healthcare Facilities - Convenient and Controlled Access
	The healthcare sector also benefits from Splan’s Mobile Credentialing. Hospitals and medical facilities use this technology to streamline visitor access. Patients' families and guests can receive digital credentials on their smartphones, allowing them to access specific areas while maintaining essential security measures. Healthcare staff can effectively monitor visitor movement and access.
	
	
	4. Retail - Personalized Shopping Experiences
	Retail establishments are incorporating Splan’s Mobile Credentialing as well. They provide QR codes or digital passes to guests for events, promotions, or exclusive sales. By doing this, they ensure that only authorized individuals can participate in special activities, creating a secure and personalized shopping experience.
	
	5. Residential Communities - Secure and Convenient Access
	Residential communities, including apartment buildings and gated neighbourhoods, find Splan’s Mobile Credentialing, invaluable. Hosts can send digital invitations to guests and contractors, granting them temporary access. This system improves security and provides residents with a more convenient and streamlined way to manage visitors.
	6. Hospitality - Elevating Guest Experiences

This convenient and secure process significantly enhances the overall guest experience.

	Work Permit Management
	
	Streamline access with robust work permit verification tailored for vendors and contractors. This feature ensures compliance and security by:
	
	
	
	Verifying work permits before access is granted.
	
	
	
	Automating permit expiry notifications.
	
	
	
	Allowing customization based on project or job type.

	Centralize and manage critical vendor and contractor documentation securely. With Splan, you can:
	
	
	
	
	Collect and store contracts, insurance, and certifications.
	
	
	
	Automate reminders for document renewal or updates.
	
	
	
	Grant access only after document compliance is verified.

	Route requests based on access level. 
	
	
	
	Filter through permit type, or project scope.
	
	
	
	Ensure proper oversight and risk mitigation.
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	Identity Verification
	Ensure that only authorized personnel gain entry with advanced identity verification. This feature supports:
	
	
	
	
	Verification using government IDs or biometric data.
	
	
	
	Cross-referencing identities against watchlists.
	
	
	
	Real-time validation to prevent unauthorized access.

	Pre-registration
	Enable vendors and contractors to complete registration in advance, reducing check-in time and ensuring compliance.
	
	 
	
	
	
	
	
	
	 
	
	
	Customizable Checklists
	Define task-specific checklists for onboarding and compliance, tailored to project or site requirements.
	
	 
	
	
	
	
	
	
	 
	
	
	Access Zone Control
	Restrict access to specific areas based on job roles or project needs, ensuring sensitive zones remain secure.
	
	 
	
	
	
	
	
	
	 
	
	
	Badge Issuance
	Provide secure, temporary badges for approved personnel, enabling controlled and traceable access within limited duration.
	
	 
	 
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	 
	
	
	Emergency Protocols
	Equip vendors and contractors with critical emergency information, including muster points and evacuation routes.

	Real-time Notifications
	Receive instant updates on vendor activities, such as arrivals, departures, and access requests, for proactive management.
	
	 
	
	
	
	
	
	
	 
	
	
	Recurring Visits
	Simplify workflows for frequent vendors by creating profiles for faster repeat check-ins and approvals.
	
	 
	 
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	Streamlined Onboarding and Access Control
	
	Splan’s seamless integration with existing systems simplifies vendor management by automating 
	onboarding processes, ensuring secure access, and maintaining compliance with organizational policies.
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	Background Check Providers
	Verify vendor credentials and their authentication automatically during registration for enhanced security.
	 
	
	
	Procurement Systems
	Eliminate duplicate data entry by pre-populating vendor information from existing procurement software.
	 
	
	
	Project Management Tools
	Synchronize access permissions with project requirements, ensuring vendors have access only to designated areas.
	 
	
	
	Photo Capture Systems
	Integrate with photo capture systems for facial recognition verification, strengthening security measures.
	 
	 
	
	
	
	
	
	 
	 
	
	
	
	
	
	Vendor/Contractor Management Resources
	
	Access insightful articles and resources to enhance your understanding of effective 
	vendor and contractor management strategies.
	 
	
	
	
	
	
	Questions & Answers
	
	
	Unsure how Splan's Vendor & Contractor Management can streamline your processes? We've got answers!
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	1. How does Splan simplify vendor onboarding?
	
	Splan offers pre-registration options for vendors, allowing them to submit information and complete compliance steps before arriving on-site. This streamlines the onboarding process and saves valuable time.

	Splan provides real-time reports detailing vendor presence, location, access history, and permit status. This data empowers you to optimize resource allocation and proactively manage potential security concerns.
	
	
	
	
	
	5. Can Splan be used for managing contractors across multiple projects?
	
	
	Splan allows you to manage contractors assigned to different projects. You can link access permissions and permits to specific projects, ensuring contractors only have access relevant to their assigned tasks.
	
	
	
	
	
	6. Does Splan offer mobile access options for vendors and contractors?
	
	Splan integrates with secure mobile wallets. This allows vendors and contractors to access facilities with their smartphones, eliminating the need for physical badges and streamlining the entry process.

Features
	 	Accelerating Security Protocols: The Influence of Advanced Visitor Management Systems on Operational Safety
	
	 	
	
	
	By Splan Marketing Team
	
	
	August 06, 2024
	
	
	
	
	
	Explore the transformative influence of advanced visitor management systems on security operations in our in-depth analysis. From real-time authorization to predictive analytics, discover how systems like Splan are reshaping security protocols with innovation and efficiency.
	1. Streamlining Access with Real-Time Authorization
	In the realm of physical security, timing isn't just a luxury—it's a critical component that separates success from vulnerability. Advanced visitor management systems like Splan are revolutionizing this space by offering real-time authorization capabilities. Imagine a scenario: an unexpected guest arrives—by simply checking their credentials against pre-approved lists and live databases, Splan immediately grants or denies access. This streamlined approach minimizes bottlenecks at entry points, keeping foot traffic flowing smoothly without compromising on safety.
	Beyond convenience, real-time authorization empowers security managers to adapt swiftly to dynamic threats. With immediate updates to access permissions, one can respond to incidents with the agility of a cat on hot bricks—evicting potential risks before they can even purr.	
	
	2. Pre-scheduled Visits for Robust Planning
	Coordination is the backbone of robust security operations. By leveraging advanced visitor management systems like Splan to schedule visits in advance, you're essentially drawing a map before embarking on a treasure hunt. No more surprises—every entrant is expected, documented, and verified. This pre-planning enables security personnel to prepare for the exact volume of visitors, ensuring adequate staff and resources are prepared.

## Splan Achieves Information Security Audit Report After Going Through SOC 2® Type II Examination / Audit.
#### The Leading Enterprise Visitor & Identity Management Solutions platform received its SOC 2® Type II report on the organization’s controls, Industry Gold Standard in Information Security.
**Fremont, California, November 30, 2022 Splan,** the leading Enterprise Visitor Management System, successfully completed the SOC 2® Type II Audit. Undergoing a rigorous audit of security process, Splan demonstrated that it meets all service commitments and system-level requirements under the Trust Service Principles and Criteria framework developed by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA).
SOC 2® Type II is a reporting framework developed by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA) that sets benchmarks for Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) companies managing customer and user data. It is a security framework that specifies how organizations should protect customer data from unauthorized access, security incidents, and other vulnerabilities. Organizational compliance is determined through a series of tests, reporting, and independent audits over six months to a year. The audit was conducted by an independent 3rd party auditing firm specializing in security audits. The audit process included an in-depth review of company policies and processes on how Splan safeguards customer data and how controls are implemented.
Why SOC 2® &CIA is important? Splan’s commitment to offer CIA (Confidentiality, Integrity & Availability) with priority of service to its customers.
* **Confidentiality** involves the efforts of an organization to make sure data is kept secret or private
* **Integrity** involves making sure your data is trustworthy and free from tampering.
* **Availability** involves making sure your data is available in time of need and to specific people.
Splan achieved the CIA (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability) aspects of information security by continuously monitoring, examining and controlling information security risks and vulnerabilities, while meeting regulatory requirements.
“SOC 2® Type II reflects the significance of Splan to provide the most trusted and securely compliant Visitor Management System platform. We are proud to be one of the industry leading Enterprise Visitor Management Systems to provide such an assurance to our customers”, said Madhu Gourineni, Co-Founder & CEO of Splan Inc
**In addition to SOC 2® Type II Audit Report, Splan is also ISO27001:2013 certified and compliant with HIPAA standards, as well as the requirements of the EU-US and Swiss-US Privacy Shield, the GDPR, and CCPA**
A copy of the SOC 2® Type 2 audit report is available under NDA by contacting [**info@splan.com**](mailto:info@splan.com.)

Security Insights
	 	Security Insights
	Top 5 Security Challenges Facing Organizations today
	 	
	
	
	By Splan Marketing Team
	
	
	
	
	
	Now more than ever organizations nationwide need to keep their security teams informed with critical real-time data. Situational awareness helps management teams decide when to take action if a situation arises and how to mitigate risk. With a main goal of reducing risk exposure by detecting and preventing emergency events from taking place; having access to the right information is crucial. Atruly secure organization has critical security data available to its security personnel in real-time, but in some organizations, this is not the case. There are many companies out there that still have not invested in a physical security solution that provides analytics and data for analysis. Therefore, security teams are faced with a myriad of challenges daily which includes:
	
	Controlling Access After Hours
	Not every employee is given access to certain locations of a building at any time of day. An employee with malicious intentions might want to go into a room where classified files are kept. The access control system would prevent the individual from entering, however that’s as far as it would go. What about finding out and identifying who the individual is to prevent it from happening again? If an organization has the ability to identify the person through analytics, then the situation can be corrected quickly.
	Tracking Occupancy
	Today’s security teams must be able to know who is on the premises and at what time. This information is not only important to have in real-time for mustering purposes, but also when it comes to adhering to COVID-19 safety guidelines. Tracking the employees in a particular location and duration in the area helps ensure social distancing. In the event of an emergency, an organization would also want to know who is at their workstation or who is already outside of the building and evacuated.
	Tailgating (unauthorized entry)
	Visitors, vendors, and contractors may want to enter a building, but they are unaware that they either need proper documentation to enter or they need to be granted access by someone on the inside. Tailgating could be caused by someone as simply as holding the door open for a visitor without a badge. A worst-case scenario of a fraudulent visitor on premises could include anything ranging from theft of equipment to unauthorized access to the company’s intranet to physical harm, or access to intellectual ranging from theft of property.
	Inactive Personnel
	Deactivating badges is crucial for the safety of an organization. For example, if a recently fired disgruntled employee has not been removed from the granted database and can still roam the halls of their previous work building, they are an immediate threat. The ex-employee may know which rooms hold the extremely valuable assets that could damage an organization’s reputation if leaked to the public.
	Lack of Communication
	Forgetting to notify a team member of a threat or not having a solid process in place leaves the door open for more threats to arise. Aligning processes and technology instantly prepares a security team to unprecedented challenges and issues.
	
	Why are analytics important?
	Security Insights serves as an analytic platform, providing analytical tools to security officers. Let’s say for instance, an ex-employee who is no longer authorized to enter a building can tailgate and enter afterhours. The current, inefficient security control system would require the security officer to go after that person, without knowing exactly who they are. Assuming there are no security cameras on the premises, the two individuals get away and the only data available to the security officer is the time of entry. The process of finding the two people becomes an extensive search due to the little information available. With Security Insights, the data collected from the worker’s badge is gathered onto the analytical platform automatically allowing security teams to react instantly.
	Splan’s Security Insights solution is the answer to solving these ongoing security challenges. By notifying the security team in real-time about the quantity and characteristics of employees or visitors on the premises; overcrowding situations can be avoided. Similarly, if an employee attempts to enter an area where they are not authorized, the platform would flag the individual and notify the security personnel immediately. The analytics can also track tailgating by detecting a person exiting a building, who was not accounted for in the entry. Inactive badge activity would no longer be an issue with the Splan solution as the system automatically updates the database and only gives access to active employees. Security personnel can now manage everything from their own dashboard using Splan’s Enterprise-Level Event Management System and get a clearer picture. The solution delivers all pertinent information quickly to an organization’s security team and provides advance notice, so preventative measures can be taken. With the range of risks that face organizations today; better decisions can be made when the right data and analytics are in front of them.
	For more information on installing visitor management software and integrating with your current access control system, please contact Splan at sales@splan.com. We can also refer you to one of our industry leading security integrator or dealer partners.

## Track Your Deliveries. Control Your Operations.
From package arrival to user satisfaction, our delivery management system ensures a complete overview.
Contact us for more Information -   [info@splan.com](mailto:info@splan.com)
Packages and Deliveries at One Place
## Efficient Delivery Pre-registration and Tracking with Splan
Splan’s Delivery Management module simplifies package handling by focusing on pre-registration and streamlined pickup notifications. Packages are pre-registered into the system, and employees are notified of arrivals via email, SMS, or phone calls for quick pickup. The module also enables scheduling outgoing deliveries, ensuring seamless operations. With features accessible through kiosks, a mobile app, or a web portal, employees can track deliveries, while lobby ambassadors manage package workflows. This efficient system optimizes delivery operations, enhances communication, and boosts productivity across your organization.
## Splan Deliveries: Manage Packages Seamlessly
Streamlined Delivery Management: Notifications, Tracking & Staff Convenience.
##### Delivery Pre-registration & Handover
Ensure efficient delivery management by pre-registering packages into the system. Upon package arrival, employees receive instant notifications via email, SMS, or phone calls. This feature simplifies the tracking process and ensures timely pickups, improving efficiency.
##### Outgoing Package Scheduling
Optimize courier operations by pre-registering outgoing packages. Schedule deliveries and manage logistics with ease through the delivery management module. This feature enhances control over package workflows, ensuring smooth dispatch and tracking.
##### Multi-Platform Accessibility
Access delivery management tools through user-friendly platforms, including self-service kiosks, the SignInEasy mobile app, and a web portal. This multi-platform support allows employees and visitors to track and manage their deliveries anytime, from any device.
## A Holistic Approach to Delivery Management
Manage every stage of the delivery process, from pre-registration to secure pickups, with advanced features that ensure efficiency, transparency, and accountability at every step.
###### Pre-registration for Deliveries
Senders can pre-register packages to streamline the receiving process. This ensures employees are notified in advance, enhancing efficiency and reducing delays.
###### Digital Proof of Delivery (ePOD)
Capture proof of delivery with digital signatures or photos. This feature ensures secure package handoffs, transparency, and complete accountability.
###### Automated 
Notifications
Employees are notified via email, SMS, or app alerts when packages arrive. These notifications are customizable, ensuring timely and efficient communication.
###### Delivery Exceptions Management
Log and manage exceptions like failed delivery attempts or unavailable recipients. Reschedule or redirect packages to resolve issues seamlessly.
###### Package Retrieval 
Kiosks
Employees can use kiosks to view and pick up their packages securely. This reduces dependency on lobby staff and ensures streamlined handoffs.
###### Scheduled Outbound Deliveries
Pre-register outgoing packages to schedule pickups efficiently. This feature ensures all outbound deliveries are tracked and securely managed.
###### Centralized Delivery Dashboard
Monitor all package activities on a single dashboard. Track delivery statuses, pending pickups, and exceptions to simplify operational oversight.
###### Delivery Analytics and Insights
Analyze delivery trends, identify bottlenecks, and optimize workflows. Gain actionable insights to enhance efficiency and improve the delivery experience.
* * *
## Delivery Analytics: Enhancing Performance and Transparency
Gain actionable insights into your delivery operations with detailed reports and configurable dashboards, enabling better decision-making and improved oversight of every package.
## Deepen Your Knowledge
Explore informative articles and resources to gain valuable insights for better security.
## Questions & Answers
Have questions about how deliveries can be integrated into your system? We're here to provide all the answers.
##### 1. Can I specify who can receive my deliveries?
Splan might allow specifying authorized recipients for packages. This could involve adding names or using employee IDs to ensure deliveries are only released to designated personnel.
##### 2. What happens if a package is damaged upon arrival?
Splan potentially allows logging damage during delivery. Lobby ambassadors could record the damage details within the system, and the recipient might be prompted to confirm the condition before signing for the package.
##### 3. Can I track the location of my delivery in real-time?
While Splan's focus seems to be on status updates, some integrations might exist with carrier tracking systems. This could allow users to see the package's location on a map through Splan's interface.
##### 4. How long are delivery records stored within Splan?
Splan's data retention policy would determine how long delivery records are stored. It's important to consult with your Splan administrator or refer to their documentation for specifics.
##### 5. Can Splan integrate with my existing delivery carrier services?
Splan might offer integrations with popular carriers. This would allow seamless tracking and potentially automate some delivery updates within the Splan system.
##### 6. Does Splan offer reporting on delivery data?
Splan's reporting features likely include delivery data. Businesses could generate reports to analyze delivery trends, identify areas for improvement, or track package history for specific employees or departments.

## Enhancing Security and Efficiency: The Importance of Integrating Visitor Management with Access Control Systems
* By Splan Marketing Team
 
* March 23, 2025
 
In today's fast-paced and dynamic business environments, ensuring the security of your premises is important. One crucial aspect of this security infrastructure is the seamless integration of a Visitor Management System (VMS) with Access Control Systems (ACS). This strategic alliance not only enhances the overall security posture but also brings about operational efficiencies.
**Monitoring and Managing Visitor Acccess**
First and foremost, connecting a VMS with ACS provides a comprehensive solution for monitoring and managing visitor access. By automating the registration process, the VMS streamlines visitor check-ins, capturing essential information and generating visitor badges with relevant access permissions. This ensures that only authorized individuals gain entry to specific areas, reducing the risk of unauthorized access and potential security breaches.
**Real-time tracking of Visitors**
Additionally, the integration facilitates real-time tracking of visitors within the campus. ACS can leverage the data collected by the VMS to monitor and control access in various zones, allowing organizations to uphold strict security protocols. In the event of an emergency or security incident, quick and accurate information about visitor whereabouts becomes invaluable for effective response and resolution.
**Improving Operational Efficiency**
Furthermore, the synergy between VMS and ACS contributes to operational efficiency. The seamless flow of data between the systems minimizes manual interventions, reducing the likelihood of errors and saving valuable time for both security personnel and visitors. Automated access permissions also enhance the overall visitor experience by ensuring swift and hassle-free entry, fostering positive impressions of the organization.
**Aiding Compliance Management**
Beyond security and efficiency, this integration aids in compliance management. Many industries, such as healthcare and finance, have stringent regulatory requirements concerning visitor access and data privacy. The combined capabilities of VMS and ACS enable organizations to maintain compliance by accurately documenting and managing visitor information while adhering to industry standards.
To conclude, the integration of Visitor Management Systems with Access Control Systems represents a proactive approach to modern security challenges. By combining these technologies, organizations can fortify their defenses against unauthorized access, enhance operational efficiency, and demonstrate commitment to regulatory compliance. As businesses evolve, investing in such integrated solutions becomes not just a security measure but a strategic imperative for sustained success.

## Splan Deepens EHR Integration with Enhanced HL7 Connector, Simplifying Healthcare Visitor Management
#### Fremont, California. January 26, 2024
Splan, a leading provider of visitor management solutions, today announced a significant upgrade to its integration with Epic software, upgrading its powerful HL7 connector. The connector enables secure and automated data exchange not just with Epic but with any EHR system across the healthcare network. This enhanced connection streamlines workflows and automate the visitor identity access process for healthcare facilities, from pre-registration and check-in to on-site management and check-out. The integration eliminates manual tasks, saving valuable time and resources for staff. Moreover, the solution supports various workflows, including COVID-19 health and safety compliance checks, fostering a safer environment.
Splan offers both lobby workstation software and self-service kiosks for visitors, ensuring a smooth and intuitive check-in process. It empowers healthcare facilities to implement personalized patient visit policies directly within the visitor management system. This integration seamlessly pulls data from any EHR system, ensuring policies like visitor limits per patient, watchlist monitoring, and automated hospice exceptions.
Imagine a scenario where a patient's record indicates they are on hospice care and only immediate family members are allowed for visits. Splan, informed by the EHR data, automatically flags unauthorized visitors, preventing unnecessary disruptions and ensuring patient comfort. Similarly, watchlists for high-risk individuals can be automatically implemented, enhancing security without manual intervention.
"Splan's HL7 connector represents a paradigm shift in healthcare visitor management,"said **Chandra Surabhi, SVP Engineering and Services** at Splan. "By unifying disparate EHR systems, we empower healthcare providers with a future-proof solution, regardless of their chosen platform. This translates to streamlined operations, robust security, and a frictionless visitor experience for everyone."
****About Splan:****
Splan is a leading provider of full-featured Unified Identity & Badging, Visitor Management solutions designed to address customers' safety, security, compliance, and digital transformation needs. Splan's solutions are deployed in a variety of industries in over 60 countries and support more than 20 languages. With a focus on empowering customers to efficiently manage visitors, vendors, tenants, contractors, and deliveries, Splan's capabilities offer risk mitigation while improving the overall visitor, contractor, and employee experience.
For more details on Splan's HL7 connector and its commitment to elevating visitor management in healthcare, please visit [**www.splan.com**](https://www.splan.com/) or [**info@splan.com**](mailto:info@splan.com.)

Splan Deepens EHR Integration with Enhanced HL7 Connector, Simplifying Healthcare Visitor Management
	Fremont, California. January 26, 2024
	
	
	 
	 	
	Splan, a leading provider of visitor management solutions, today announced a significant upgrade to its integration with Epic software, upgrading its powerful HL7 connector. The connector enables secure and automated data exchange not just with Epic but with any EHR system across the healthcare network. This enhanced connection streamlines workflows and automate the visitor identity access process for healthcare facilities, from pre-registration and check-in to on-site management and check-out. The integration eliminates manual tasks, saving valuable time and resources for staff. Moreover, the solution supports various workflows, including COVID-19 health and safety compliance checks, fostering a safer environment.
	Splan offers both lobby workstation software and self-service kiosks for visitors, ensuring a smooth and intuitive check-in process. It empowers healthcare facilities to implement personalized patient visit policies directly within the visitor management system. This integration seamlessly pulls data from any EHR system, ensuring policies like visitor limits per patient, watchlist monitoring, and automated hospice exceptions.
	Imagine a scenario where a patient's record indicates they are on hospice care and only immediate family members are allowed for visits. Splan, informed by the EHR data, automatically flags unauthorized visitors, preventing unnecessary disruptions and ensuring patient comfort. Similarly, watchlists for high-risk individuals can be automatically implemented, enhancing security without manual intervention.
	"Splan's HL7 connector represents a paradigm shift in healthcare visitor management,"said Chandra Surabhi, SVP Engineering and Services at Splan. "By unifying disparate EHR systems, we empower healthcare providers with a future-proof solution, regardless of their chosen platform. This translates to streamlined operations, robust security, and a frictionless visitor experience for everyone."
	
	About Splan:
	Splan is a leading provider of full-featured Unified Identity & Badging, Visitor Management solutions designed to address customers' safety, security, compliance, and digital transformation needs. Splan's solutions are deployed in a variety of industries in over 60 countries and support more than 20 languages. With a focus on empowering customers to efficiently manage visitors, vendors, tenants, contractors, and deliveries, Splan's capabilities offer risk mitigation while improving the overall visitor, contractor, and employee experience.
	For more details on Splan's HL7 connector and its commitment to elevating visitor management in healthcare, please visit www.splan.com or 
	info@splan.com
